page.title: 11DAIRY FARMING NEAR EARDISLEY
page.content: We have got lots of animals including chickens,cows,lambs,sheep,calves, ponies and lots of other small pets. Life on a dairy farm is difficult now quotas are in. The quota is something the government tells all British farmers how much milk they can produce.If you produce too much or too little the farmer gets fined a lot of money.To stop this happening farmers have had to sell many cows so they do not get a good price for their animals.Many farmers are going bankrupt.We have around 32 Fresian cows.Some of them are dry in the summer which means they cannot be milked as they are saving their milk for their calf.Sometimes we help our Dad to milk.The milk is put into a cooling tank until it is collected by a big tanker every morning and taken to a chocolate factory in Leominster.
